meanings.definition: The state or quality of having eyes.
meanings.sent1: Her eyedness allowed her to see the beautiful sunset.
meanings.sent2: The animal's eyedness was evident in its keen sense of sight.
meanings.sent3: The party theme was 'eyedness' where everyone had to wear eye-shaped accessories.
meanings.sent4: In the land of imagination, eyedness was not limited to physical eyes but extended to the soul's vision.
meanings.sent5: The artist captured the essence of eyedness in his painting, depicting eyes as windows to the soul.

meanings.definition: The ability to see or perceive visually.
meanings.sent1: His keen eyedness helped him spot the hidden treasure.
meanings.sent2: The detective's success was due to his sharp eyedness in solving cases.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick relied on the audience's lack of eyedness to see the sleight of hand.
meanings.sent4: In the world of art, true beauty lies in the eyedness of the beholder.
meanings.sent5: The photographer's skillful eyedness captured the essence of the bustling city streets.
